title: [K-12] Neuromorphic Network-Based Language Learning Design: Learning-Sleep-Recovery Cycle and Language Pattern (Reading, Writing) Enhancement Model

context.prior_knowledge: Basic electrical circuit concepts, foundational understanding of biological neural networks, basic awareness of language structures (vocabulary/grammar), and foundational reading-writing skills
context.additional_context: Utilizes visual materials (text/lexical maps) and simplified experimental simulations for smartphone-based language learning. Introduces neuromorphic computing concepts linked to reinforcing language patterns (improving reading/writing skills). Experimental design focuses on enhancing learners' expressive abilities and grammar application.

learning_goals: Explain the basic principles of neuromorphic networks (roles of silver nanowires and TiO₂ structures) from the perspective of language pattern processing (lexical and grammatical structures).
Analyze the impact of the learning-sleep-recovery cycle on artificial neural networks’ recognition of language patterns (text structures) using experimental data.
Apply voltage pulse-controlled memory reinforcement mechanisms to language pattern learning models (e.g., enhancing vocabulary, grammar structures, and writing skills).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
